findings.title: Insufficient Token Distribution Explanation and Misalignment with Block Rewards-Based Distribution Design
findings.description: Token circulation deviates from the team's planned token distribution outlined in the documentation due to lack of information about native tokens generated as block rewards, leading to potential discrepancies.

findings.title: Native Token balance manipulation due to wrong StateDBWrapper implementation
findings.description: The issue arises from incorrect SubBalance and AddBalance function implementations within the StateDBWrapper, leading to potential native token balance manipulation.

findings.title: Failure to Restore Native Token Balance upon Transferring and Executing Transaction Revert
findings.description: The code for revert related to balance transfer does not properly restore the native token balance, allowing a malicious user to freeze it for all smart contracts existing in the rigo ecosystem.

findings.title: Incorrect Txhash Setting in Event Log
findings.description: The code sets txhash of logs to the current transaction hash instead of the actual transaction hash.

findings.title: Validator Slashing Does Not Impact Delegated User Assets
findings.description: The code fails to subtract holdings of users delegated to a validator when it engages in negative behavior, allowing malicious validators to exploit the system.

findings.title: Block Timestamp is incorrectly set to nanoseconds
findings.description: The block.timestamp is set in nanoseconds, not seconds, which may cause the EVM to calculate an excessively large value when determining how much to pay out in certain situations.

findings.title: Overflow Risk in EndVotingHeight and ApplyingHeight within Governance Module Proposals
findings.description: The code does not perform overflow checks on EndVotingHeight and ApplyingHeight when creating a Proposal for a new GovRule inside the Governance Module, which may cause the Proposal to end without allowing enough voting time.

findings.title: Incomplete Update of Staking Object with GovRule Changes through Voting
findings.description: The values of existing stake objects are not updated when a new GovRule is applied through voting.

findings.title: Checking TRX_STAKING type transaction in wrong place
findings.description: The given code validates a Transaction of type TRX_STAKING in the Governance Module, not the Stake Module.

findings.title: No Block Reward for Empty Blocks
findings.description: The code does not call the doReward function when there are no transactions in the block, which means stakers will not receive rewards.
